title: "Multivariate Viz"
---

::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_7f643234e7c1a562899d10598cdbdb35'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```


::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_1a745b6d550c7c8580304148ac56f04b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Import and check out data
education <- read.csv("https://mac-stat.github.io/data/sat.csv")
head(education)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
       State expend ratio salary frac verbal math  sat  fracCat
1    Alabama  4.405  17.2 31.144    8    491  538 1029   (0,15]
2     Alaska  8.963  17.6 47.951   47    445  489  934 (45,100]
3    Arizona  4.778  19.3 32.175   27    448  496  944  (15,45]
4   Arkansas  4.459  17.1 28.934    6    482  523 1005   (0,15]
5 California  4.992  24.0 41.078   45    417  485  902  (15,45]
6   Colorado  5.443  18.4 34.571   29    462  518  980  (15,45]
```
:::
:::


## Exercise 1
### (a)

::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_9842970a8d6a71d9c2e4555adbee8364'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(education, aes(x=sat)) +
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### (b)
The range of score is from about 840 to 1110, the typical outcome is around 900 and the plot is left-shifted.


## Exercise 2

### (a)

::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_7ebfae016aa50e7fe5b51c2b55cdf4e0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Construct a plot of sat vs expend
# Include a "best fit linear regression model" (HINT: method = "lm")
lm(data = education, sat ~ expend)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = sat ~ expend, data = education)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)       expend  
    1089.29       -20.89  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(education, aes(x = expend, y = sat)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_abline(intercept = 1089.29, slope = -20.89)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_3e15ce50825eca676edeffb30ec47733'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Construct a plot of sat vs salary
# Include a "best fit linear regression model" (HINT: method = "lm")
ggplot(education, aes(x = expend, y = salary)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### (b)
The higher expend on pupil, the lower the sat score, and the higher the salary for teachers, the higher the sat score. It is surprising that students will get lower score when there are more money spend on them.


## Exercise 3

::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_ac85af402c594a0340d04f1d821f213e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(education, aes(x = expend, y = sat, color = salary)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: The following aesthetics were dropped during statistical transformation:
colour.
ℹ This can happen when ggplot fails to infer the correct grouping structure in
  the data.
ℹ Did you forget to specify a `group` aesthetic or to convert a numerical
  variable into a factor?
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Exercise 4


::: {.cell hash='activity-05_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_fbe13611f699856971b3c432bef7000e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(education, aes(y = sat, x = salary, color = cut(expend, 2))) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE, method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(education, aes(y = sat, x = salary, color = cut(expend, 3))) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(se = FALSE, method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](activity-05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::
